workflow.name: Automate candidate rejections with Google Sheets, GPT-4o-mini, Gmail & ClickUp
workflow.description:
## Description
This workflow automates the candidate rejection process after interviews. It retrieves interview feedback from Google Sheets, uses AI to structure and score candidate data, applies a scoring threshold, and routes underperforming candidates into a rejection path. The system generates compassionate, professional HTML rejection emails and logs the decision in ClickUp‚Äîensuring candidates receive timely communication while HR teams save time.

**What This Template Does**
üìã Fetch Interview Feedback from Google Sheets
 Pulls structured interview responses from a connected sheet.
üß† AI-Powered Candidate Profiling
 GPT-4o-mini structures raw feedback into candidate profiles with scores and notes.
‚öñÔ∏è Apply Threshold (‚â• 3 = Pass, < 3 = Reject)
 Marks candidates who fail to meet the minimum criteria.
üîÄ Route Candidates via If Node
 Rejects candidates with scores below the threshold. (Accepted path is not implemented in this workflow.)
üì© Generate Rejection Email
 AI crafts a professional, empathetic HTML email with personalized feedback.
üì® Send Email via Gmail
 Delivers the rejection email directly to the candidate.
üóÇ Create ClickUp Task
 Logs each rejected candidate into ClickUp for record-keeping and team visibility.

**Prerequisites**

- Google Sheet with interview feedback data
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- Azure OpenAI API key with GPT-4o-mini access
- Gmail API credentials (for sending rejection emails)
- ClickUp API credentials (for rejection tracking)

**Step-by-Step Setup**

- Connect Google Sheets ‚Üí Pull raw candidate interview responses.
- AI Processing (LLM Chain) ‚Üí Structure candidate feedback into JSON profiles with scores.
- Apply Threshold Check (Code Node) ‚Üí Mark candidates as rejected if their averageScore < 3.
- Route with If Node ‚Üí Only the rejection path is configured.
- Generate Rejection Email (LLM Chain) ‚Üí Create respectful, personalized HTML email.
- Format Metadata (Code Node) ‚Üí Combine email + candidate info.
- Send Email via Gmail ‚Üí Notify candidates of rejection.
- Create ClickUp Task ‚Üí Record rejection decision for transparency.

**Customization Ideas**
 üéØ Adjust the rejection threshold (e.g., < 3.5 instead of < 3).
 üì¢ Add recruiter Slack/Teams notifications when a rejection is processed.
 üìö Sync rejection emails and candidate profiles into Notion or Airtable for reporting.
 üí° Include AI-suggested ‚Äúareas for improvement‚Äù in rejection emails.

**Key Benefits**
 ‚úÖ Ensures timely, consistent rejection communication
 ‚úÖ Saves HR teams hours of manual follow-up
 ‚úÖ Maintains candidate dignity with professional, empathetic emails
 ‚úÖ Keeps transparent rejection records in ClickUp
 ‚úÖ 100% automated and customizable

**Perfect For**
 üë• HR teams managing high-volume hiring rejections
 üè¢ Companies aiming for consistent candidate communication
 üéØ Recruiters who want to provide personalized but automated rejection emails
 üìä Organizations that need structured rejection records

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
